content.body: For Decorators, is there anyone who would like to volunteer to lead the discussion in the likely case that Jacob cannot do it?
I retracted my suggestion to do it anyway, in case you are asking because of my suggestion
Measuring height of person: https://xkcd.com/3164/
waldemar: Could you coment here on what you would've said with your "disagree" reply?
content.formatted_body: waldemar: Could you coment here on what you would've said with your "disagree" reply?

content.body: (I'm confused. Isn't Watt an SI unit for Power, and Joule for Energy?)
indeed: https://www.bipm.org/documents/20126/41483022/SI-Brochure-9-EN.pdf#page=23
kwh is my favorite si unit
The summary included an incorrect assertion that no one wanted an Amount that only does precision with no units. That's what I disagreed with.
I had earlier stated in the conversation that I would support such a thing.
Would you prefer an Amount that initially did not support unit conversion?
"Paving desire paths" - making existing usage easier and robust
Precision of a decimal number and unit conversion are two very different things. There are plentiful use cases of one without the other.
There exist use cases for both simultaneously, but that doesn't mean that all decimal number precision should be tied to unit conversions and vice versa.
https://www.w3.org/TR/html-design-principles/#pave-the-cowpaths
Relatedly, do we have some connection to stateofjs?
I agree. Do I understand right that you would not be opposed to an initial Amount that also supported unit conversion, provided that we find agreement on the details thereof?
i think the survey owner is in the general channel
not afaik but the person usually solicitcs feedback in #tc39-general:matrix.org before launching
content.formatted_body: not afaik but the person usually solicitcs feedback in #tc39-general:matrix.org before launching

content.body: Olivier FlÃ¼ckiger: Does V8 cache the result of the internal equivalent to getNonIndexStringProperties?
content.formatted_body: Olivier FlÃ¼ckiger: Does V8 cache the result of the internal equivalent to getNonIndexStringProperties?

content.body: Ok, just came to mind re. "surveys are hard". We noticed that in the "pick 3 items" sections the distribution follows almost exactly the order of questions asked.
No, we cache a list of enumerable properties in the order of enumeration.
I have some concerns that each of the new getXYZPropreties will be expected to be cached but that will induce memory overhead in all cases without non-trivial effort
Is that a concern that other engines share? It's not super strong opinion FWIW
I also don't mean the actual cached data itself I mean the pointer to the cached data
Yeah, that is a good point. We would not plan to add a cache. I recently added a fast-path for getOwnPropertySymbols without a cache. That gave about 30% speedup, but same copmlexity class.
* I also don't mean the actual cached data itself I mean the pointer to the possibly cached data

m.new_content.body: I also don't mean the actual cached data itself I mean the pointer to the possibly cached data

content.body: * I also don't necessarily mean the actual cached data itself I mean the pointer to the possibly cached data

m.new_content.body: I also don't necessarily mean the actual cached data itself I mean the pointer to the possibly cached data

content.body: But I think anything else than enumeration would not be critical enough to warrant a cache
If this is not cached and requires iterating through the properties, is it actually going to be meaningfully faster than iterating in JS?
Well, same as with counting keys, we would not create the keys array.
and also no regex, but an internal test.
I think it would be faster for us, because we can just walk a shape
* I think it would be faster for us, because we can just walk a shape-lineage

m.new_content.body: I think it would be faster for us, because we can just walk a shape-lineage

content.body: In https://github.com/BridgeAR/array-get-non-index-string-properties I do not see any _real_ use case. We are now talking about "errors", "logging", there is no mentioning of "logging" _neither_ "errors" on the proposal so far.
content.formatted_body: In https://github.com/BridgeAR/array-get-non-index-string-properties I do not see any real use case. We are now talking about "errors", "logging", there is no mentioning of "logging" neither "errors" on the proposal so far.

content.body: Node.js' use of this doesn't require caching. I wouldn't expect that at all
fwiw `console.log` is a universal use case for exactly "describing every kind of thing", and the committee spent a TON of effort in ES6 trying to make web behavior implementable in JS
content.formatted_body: fwiw console.log is a universal use case for exactly "describing every kind of thing", and the committee spent a TON of effort in ES6 trying to make web behavior implementable in JS

content.body: I do think it's interesting hearing from Jordan/Mathieu/Ruben on use cases but the current examples on the proposal repo itself seem a bit contentious to me
Aren't they different big-O with the caching? I don't think you can say either way.
* Aren't they different big-O with the caching? I don't think one can say either way.

m.new_content.body: Aren't they different big-O with the caching? I don't think one can say either way.
